images.copyright: Aerial view of car crossing over the frozen surface of Lake Baikal, Russia (© Amazing Aerial Agency/Offset)
images.title: The Pearl of Siberia
images.caption: The Pearl of Siberia
images.desc: Lake Baikal is a record-holding wonder: It’s the world’s oldest (25 million years), deepest (over 5,000ft in some parts) and largest freshwater lake (containing more than 20 per cent of the Earth’s fresh surface water by volume). Baikal lies in the deepest continental rift valley on Earth, and because the rift is geologically active, the tectonic plates continue to move farther apart.
